column2: US
column6: UK

column2: WHO Announces Mysterious Coronavirus-Related Pneumonia in Wuhan, China
CDC Says 3 US Airports Will Begin Screening for Coronavirus
CDC Confirms First US Coronavirus Case, Chinese Scientist Confirms COVID-19 Human Transmission
Wuhan Now Under Quarantine
WHO Issues Global Health Emergency
column6: The first two cases of coronavirus (2019-nCoV) in the United Kingdom are confirmed

column2: Global Air Travel Is Restricted
US Declares Public Health Emergency

column6: A third case of coronavirus is confirmed in the UK

column2: China’s COVID-19 Deaths Exceed Those of SARS Crisis
column6: The total number of cases in the UK reaches eight as four further cases are confirmed in people linked to an affected man from Brighton
A ninth case is confirmed in London
The DHSC confirms a total of 13 cases in the UK as four new cases in passengers on the cruise ship Diamond Princess are detected. They are transferred to hospitals in the UK

column2: CDC Says COVID-19 Is Heading Toward Pandemic Status

column6: The first British death from the disease is confirmed by the Japanese Health Ministry; a man quarantined on the Diamond Princess cruise ship
The BBC reports the first case of a man in Surrey to be infected with COVID-19 whilst in the UK who had not recently travelled abroad
The first death from coronavirus in the UK is confirmed

column2: 21 Passengers on California Cruise Ship Test Positive
column6: A third death from coronavirus is reported; number of cases in the UK reaches 273

column2: WHO Declares COVID-19 a Pandemic

column6: Public Health England stops performing contact tracing, as widespread infections overwhelm capacity

column2: Trump Declares COVID-19 a National Emergency; Travel Ban on Non-US Citizens Traveling From Europe Goes Into Effect
column6: Elections including the English local elections, London mayoral election and police and crime commissioner elections, scheduled for May 2020, are postponed for a year because of the coronavirus

column2: University of Minnesota Begins Testing Hydroxychloroquine, CMS Temporarily Expands Use of Telehealth, Administration Asks Congress to Send Americans Direct Financial Relief
column6: NHS England announces that from 15 April all non-urgent operations in England will be postponed, to free up 30,000 beds to help tackle the virus

column2: California Issues Statewide Stay-at-Home Order

column6: Prime Minister Boris Johnson orders all cafes, pubs and restaurants to close from the evening of 20 March, except for take-away food, to tackle coronavirus. All the UK's nightclubs, theatres, cinemas, gyms and leisure centres are told to close "as soon as they reasonably can"
The Health Protection (Coronavirus, Business Closure) (England) Regulations 2020 (SI 327) come into legal effect at 2pm

column4: One day Janta Curfew; Passenger air travel suspended till further notice; Final airlift from Italy (Total of 564 Indians), India observed a 14-hour curfew;
column6: Boris Johnson warns that "tougher measures" may be introduced if people do not follow government advice on social distancing
Boris Johnson announces a UK-wide partial lockdown

column2: With Clinical Trials on Hold, Innovation Stalls
column6: Health Secretary Matt Hancock announces the government will open a temporary hospital; The Church of England closes all its buildings

column2: Reports Find Extended Shutdowns Can Delay Second Wave
column6: The police will be given the power to use "reasonable force" to enforce the lockdown regulations

column2: Senate Passes CARES Act
column6: The Health Protection (Coronavirus, Restrictions) (England) Regulations 2020 (SI 350) (the 'Lockdown Regulations') come into effect, significantly extending the range of businesses that are required by law to close with immediate effect including all retail businesses not on an approved list. These regulations also include significant restrictions on freedom of movement: "no person may leave the place where they are living without reasonable excuse"

column2: Trump Signs CARES Act Into Law

column4: Final airlift from Iran (Total of 764 Indians)

column2: FDA Authorizes Use of Hydroxychloroquine
COVID-19 Can Be Transmitted Through the Eye
column4: Cluster identified: Delhi religious congregation event - Tablighi Jamaat

column2: Troubles With the COVID-19 Cocktail

column6: England's deputy chief medical officer, tells the UK Government's daily briefing the lockdown is "beginning to pay off" but the UK is still in a "dangerous situation"

column4: 10,000 confirmed cases; Nationwide lock-down extended till 3 May

column6: Health Secretary Matt Hancock announces new guidelines that will allow close family members to see dying relatives in order to say goodbye to them

column2: “Gating Criteria” Emerge as a Way to Reopen the Economy

column6: Matt Hancock confirms coronavirus tests will be rolled out to cover more public service staff such as police officers, firefighters and prison staff

column2: Young, Poor Avoid Care for COVID-19 Symptoms
NIH Trial Shows Early Promise for Remdesivir
Remdesivir Wins EUA
column4: Nationwide lock-down further extended till 17 May
Liquor shops reopen across the country

column2: Saliva-Based Diagnostic Test Allowed for At-Home Use
column4: ICMR announces tie up with Bharat Biotech to develop indigenous vaccine for Covid-19

column6: A new alert scale system is announced, ranging from green (level one) to red (level five), similar to the UK's Terror Threat Levels; A recorded address by Boris Johnson is broadcast at 7pm in which he outlines a "conditional plan" to reopen society, but says it is "not the time simply to end the lockdown this week", and describes the plans as "the first careful steps to modify our measures". Those who cannot work from home, such as construction workers and those in manufacturing, are encouraged to return to work from the following day, but to avoid public transport if possible. The guidance on the number of outdoor exercise periods will be lifted from Wednesday 13 May; Outlining future easing of restrictions, Johnson says "step two" – no sooner than 1 June – would include reopening some shops and the return of primary school pupils, beginning with reception, Year 1 and Year 6; and that secondary pupils facing exams next year would get some time in school before the summer holiday. "Step three" – at the earliest by July – would begin the reopening of the hospitality industry and other public places
The UK government advises people in England to wear face coverings in enclosed spaces where social distancing is not possible, such as on public transport and in shops

column2: Death Toll Likely Underestimated, Fauci Testifies

column6: The Health Protection (Coronavirus, Restrictions) (England) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2020 (SI 500) come into effect, allowing the re-opening of garden centres, sports courts and recycling centres
Public Health England approves a blood test developed by Roche Diagnostics that can detect COVID-19 antibodies
Matt Hancock announces that every resident and staff member in care homes in England will be tested for COVID-19 by early June

column4: Nationwide lockdown further extended till 31 May

column2: United States and AstraZeneca Form Vaccine Deal

column6: Samples from blood donors in London during the past week (reported by Public Health England on 4 June) show antibodies indicating exposure to COVID-19 in around 16% of people; Boris Johnson confirms plans (outlined on 10 May) for the phased reopening of schools in England from 1 June: from that date, they will reopen for early years pupils, Reception, Year 1 and Year 6. For the first time he states that from 15 June a quarter of Year 10 and Year 12 students will be allowed "some contact" to help prepare for exams
Boris Johnson outlines plans to reopen car showrooms and outdoor markets from 1 June, and for all non-essential shops to reopen from 15 June
Boris Johnson states that a test and trace system will be operational in England from the following day

column2: US COVID-19 Deaths Pass the 100,000 Mark
column6: Contact tracing systems go live in England and Scotland

The prohibitions on leaving home are replaced by a prohibition on staying overnight away from home; Gatherings of people from more than one household are limited to six people outdoors and are prohibited
disproportionately high number of people from ethnic minorities dying from COVID-19

column2: Lancet, NEJM Retract COVID-19 Studies on Hydroxychloroquine
column6: face coverings will be compulsory on public transport from 15 June
The UK government drops plans for all primary school children to return to school before the end of the summer term, describing it as unfeasible

column2: US COVID-19 Cases Reach 2 Million
column4: Recoveries exceed ative cases for the first time
India overtook UK to become 4th worst-hit coronavirus country

column6: Boris Johnson commissions a review into the 2-metre social distancing rule

general re-opening of English retail shops and public-facing businesses, requiring travellers on public transport in England to wear a face covering, Secondary school pupils in England from Year Ten and Year Twelve return to school

column2: HHS Announces COVID-19 Vaccine Doses Will Be Free for Some
WHO Ends Study Into Hydroxychloroquine

column6: government announces a £1bn fund to help children in England to catch up with work they have missed while schools have been closed

column2: NIH Halts Trial of Hydroxychloroquine
Study Suggests 80% of Cases in March Went Undetected

column6: social distancing rules for England will be relaxed from 4 July
government announces plans to relax rules for England and Wales allowing pubs and restaurants to utilise outdoor spaces

column2: White House Coronavirus Task Force Addresses Rising Cases in the South
Gilead Sets Price for Remdesivir at $3120
Fauci Warns New COVID-19 Cases Could Hit 100,000 a Day
column6: any GCSE or A Level student who is unhappy with the results they are given will be able to sit exams in all subjects in the autumn

column2: States Reverse Reopening Plans

column6: list of 59 countries for which quarantine will not apply when arriving back in England as from 10 July

column2: Scientists, Citing Airborne Transmission, Ask WHO to Revise Guidance
column4: India overtakes Russia to become third worst-hit country
column6: government announces a £111m scheme to help firms in England provide an extra 30,000 trainee places

column2: CMS Plans to Pay More for Home Dialysis Equipment, US Surpasses 3 Million Infections, Begins WHO Withdrawal
WHO Announces COVID-19 Can Be Airborne
States With COVID-19 Spikes Report Greatest Health Insurance Coverage Losses,  Early Moderna Data Point to Vaccine Candidate’s Efficacy
New Hospital Data Reporting Protocol Prompts Concern
column4: Phase-1 clinical trials of India’s first indigenous Covid-19 vaccine, Covaxin

column2: US Reports New Record of Daily COVID-19 Cases

column6: Concerns are raised about England's contact-tracing system as it emerges that at least 50% of the people identified as having had close contact with someone in Blackburn who has tested positive for COVID-19 have not been contacted

column2: Diagnostic Delays From COVID-19 May Increase Cancer-Related Deaths
Vaccines From AstraZeneca, CanSino Biologics Show Promising Results
HHS, DOD Announce Vaccine Distribution Agreement With Pfizer and BioNTech
column6: government permits visits to care homes

column2: Antibody Levels Drop After First 3 Months of COVID-19 Infection, Antibody Cocktail May Treat, Prevent COVID-19

column6: requiring members of the public to wear a face covering in most indoor shops

column4: BCCI announces IPL to be held in UAE from September 19

column2: Senate Introduces HEALS Act
FDA Grants Truvian EUA for Rapid Antibody Test

column6: Office for National Statistics figures indicate that England had the highest number of excess deaths in Europe between the end of February and mid-June, and had the second highest peak in number of deaths behind Spain

column2: New US Pandemic Phase; US to Pay Sanofi, GlaxoSmithKline $2B for Vaccine
column4: Serum Institute of India got approval from DCGI for trial phases II & III

column2: Rural Hotspots Face Lack of Intensive Care Unit Beds
Talks Stall on Second Relief Package

column6: 50 million face masks bought by the UK government for use by NHS England in April will not be used due to safety concerns
The Health Protection Regulations 2020 come into effect, extending the range of indoor locations where a face covering has to be worn

column2: Trump Administration Reaches Deal With Moderna
Severe Obesity Increases Mortality Risk From COVID-19
Biden Calls for 3-Month Mask Mandate
column6: A Level results are published. In England, 36% of results are lower than teachers predicted; Boris Johnson announces a further easing of lockdown measures for England from 15 August

column2: FDA Approves Saliva Test

column6: The Sunday Telegraph reports that Public Health England is to be replaced by a new organisation tasked with protecting the UK against future pandemics

column2: COVID-19 Now the Third-Leading Cause of Death in the US

column6: The ban on evictions due to expire on 23 August is extended until 20 September amid concerns that thousands of people could be made homeless

column2: Convalescent Plasma Is Cleared for Use by FDA
Remdesivir’s Clinical Benefits Questioned
CDC Changes Testing Guidance, but Later Reverses Itself
FDA Grants EUA to Abbott’s Rapid Test
column4: Serum Institute of India starts India trials of Covishield

column2: First Known Case of COVID-19 Reinfection Reported in the US

column6: The activist Piers Corbyn has been fined £10,000 for organising an anti-lockdown rally in Trafalgar Square, London

column4: India's GDP contracts 23.9% in April-June quarter

column2: US Rejects WHO Global COVID-19 Vaccine Effort
Steroids Reduce Mortality in Severe Cases; Sanofi, GSK Begin Human Vaccine Trials, Bioethicists Weigh In on Equitable Vaccine Distribution

column4: India became second worst-affected country after the US

column2: AstraZeneca Halts Phase 3 Vaccine Trial
US Airports Stop Screening International Travelers; Pfizer, BioNTech Expand Phase 3 Trial; NIH Launches Investigation Into Halted Astrazeneca Trial
column6: The Health Protection Regulations 2020 came into force at 12.01 a.m. Unless one of the exceptions applies, the statutory instrument provides authority to limit the number of persons in a gathering to no more than six

column2: CDC Reports on Spread of COVID-19 at Restaurants
Trump Administration Releases Vaccine Distribution Plan
Europe Reports Rising COVID-19 Cases

column6: The Office for National Statistics says that new COVID-19 cases may have reached 6,000 a day in England, with a clear rise in cases in those under the age of 35
Health Secretary Matt Hancock warns people in England that tougher COVID-19 restrictions will follow if they do not follow the rules

column2: CDC Pulls Guidance Saying COVID-19 Transmission Is Airborne; Johnson & Johnson Begins Phase 3 Vaccine Trial
column6: government announces that pubs and restaurants in England must close at 22:00 from Thursday 24 September

column4: India reported over 100,000 coronavirus recoveries in a single-day for the first time
column6: Boris Johnson tells the House of Commons the United Kingdom has reached "a perilous turning point" as he announces new restrictions for England that could last for as long as six months; People are also told to work from home if they can

column2: A New, More Contagious Strain of COVID-19 Is Discovered
Midwest States See Increase in COVID-19 Cases
Global COVID-19 Deaths Surpass 1 Million
column4: Global death count crossed one million
column6: Refusing to self-isolate in England after being told to self-isolate becomes illegal, with a fine of up to £10,000

column2: HHS to Distribute 100 Million Rapid Tests to States, Regeneron Announces Positive Results for Monoclonal Antibody Treatment
Trump, First Lady Test Positive for COVID-19; Trump Enters Hospital
Trump Leaves Hospital, Continues Receiving Treatment
column4: Government said 20-25 cr (10,000,000) people to be vaccinated by July 25

column6: London now has an infection rate of more than 1,000 new COVID-19 cases a day, with 16 boroughs reporting more than 60 new cases per 100,000 people. The increase is thought to be partly due to an upsurge in testing

column2: NEJM Criticizes Trump’s COVID-19 Response; 39 States See Case Spikes; More Americans Trust Biden to Lead Health Care; White House COVID-19 Outbreak Grows to 34 System
column6: After details of possible new restrictions to close pubs and restaurants in the areas of England most affected by COVID-19 appear in newspapers ahead of any announcement by the government, MPs and local leaders seek clarification on the situation

column2: US Signs Deal With AstraZeneca

column6: Five people are arrested and a police officer is injured at an anti-lockdown protest in London

column2: Johnson & Johnson Halts Vaccine Trial

column6: The COVID-19 tier regulations come into force, defining three levels of restrictions to be applied as necessary in geographic areas

column2: US Cases Spike Again; Studies Connect Blood Type and COVID-19 Risk

column6: Mayor of Greater Manchester Andy Burnham accuses Boris Johnson of exaggerating the risk of COVID-19

column2: Global Cases Top 40 Million
FDA Approves Remdesivir as First COVID-19 Drug
AstraZeneca and Johnson & Johnson Announce Restart of COVID-19 Vaccine Trials
column6: The coronavirus fatality rate in England increases for the first time since the apex of April 2020
Following criticism of Test and Trace, the mandatory 14-day quarantine for contacts of people who receive a positive test for COVID-19 may be reduced to 10 days, or even 1 week

column4: Govt asked state to prepare 3-tier system for vaccine rollout
column6: A BMA survey of 6,610 physicians reveals that 37% hold the view that the recently implemented tier system in England will be an ineffectual measure
COVID-19 tests that provide a result within an hour are being piloted at universities in England in order to allow students to return home for Christmas

column2: CMS Issues Vaccine, Treatment Coverage Rules

column6: More than 10% of London hospital beds are in use with COVID-19 patients as the NHS comes under pressure due to a second wave
Business leaders criticise plans for a second lockdown in England, citing the "immense" damage it will do to businesses
Cabinet Office Minister Michael Gove confirms the four-week England lockdown could be extended beyond 2 December; Religious groups criticise the new lockdown rules that ban communal worship

Boris Johnson tells the House of Commons the UK faces a "medical and moral disaster" without the planned month-long lockdown for England, but that it will end "without a shred of doubt" on 2 December; Chancellor Rishi Sunak announces that self-employed people will be able to claim 80% of their earnings during the lockdown period

column2: US Reports Unprecedented 100,000 Cases in 1 Day
column6: The NHS in England is put on the highest alert level; New guidelines are issued for care homes allowing visitors

column2: Study Predicts Difficulties in Nationwide COVID-19 Immunity
President-Elect Biden Announces COVID-19 Transition Team; Pfizer Publishes Vaccine Results; FDA Issues EUA for Eli Lilly’s Antibody Treatment
column4: Pfizer and BioNtech said vaccine candidate more than 90% effective
column6: The organisers of a Manchester anti-lockdown demonstration involving 600 people are issued with a £10,000 fine

column4: Delhi in midst of third wave

column2: Indoor Venues Responsible for Much of COVID-19’s Spread
column6: An Evacuation-style operation to get students home safely for Christmas is announced. They will be offered rapid COVID tests, and allocated travel dates in a "student travel window" between 3–9 December

column2: Moderna Reveals Vaccine Efficacy Results; FDA to Move Rapidly on EUAs for Pfizer, Moderna Vaccines
Fauci Highlights the Need for Long-term Follow-up of COVID-19 Effects
Pfizer, BioNTech Vaccine Is 95% Effective
Pfizer, BioNTech Submit EUA Application; CDC Warns Against Holiday Travel

column6: Downing Street confirms plans to introduce a tougher three-tier system of COVID restrictions for England when the lockdown ends on 2 December; Dozens of arrests are made after hundreds attend anti-lockdown protest in Liverpool, and other parts of England

column2: AstraZeneca Reports Vaccine Is 90% Effective; FDA Grants EUA for Second Antibody Treatment

column6: A laboratory error leads to hundreds of people wrongly being told they have tested positive for COVID-19 by NHS Test and Trace

column4: Vaccine trial participant demand Rs 50,000,000 in damages

column6: relatives of people in care homes in England can visit if they receive a negative COVID-19 test
Figures from the Office for National Statistics indicate COVID-19 rates are falling in every part of England apart from the North East

GP surgeries will receive supplies of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine on 14 December, and have been told to have vaccination centres staffed and ready to deliver the vaccine within three and a half days of that date

column2: FDA Advisory Panel Recommends Pfizer, BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine
column6: Figures from NHS England show the number of patients in England waiting over a year for routine hospital care is now 100 times higher than before the pandemic

column2: FDA Agrees to EUA for COVID-19 Vaccine From Pfizer, BioNTech

column6: identification of a new strain of the virus that spreads much quicker; Education Secretary Gavin Williamson orders the authority to keep schools open or face legal action
Mass testing of secondary school pupils will be greatly increased in January

column2: FDA Panel Backs Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine
FDA Signs Off on EUA for Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine
column6: 90% of hospital beds in England are full
Anti-lockdown protests are held in cities across the country, with police making 27 arrests at a protest in London

column2: New COVID-19 Variant Circling the UK
column6: Sir Patrick Vallance, the UK's chief scientific adviser, suggests that more areas of England will need to go into Tier 4 restrictions to combat the new variant of COVID-19

column2: US Buys More Pfizer Vaccine

column6: Figures released by the Office for National Statistics indicate 1 in 85 people in England has COVID
Police break up an illegal rave attended by 100 people in the Shudehill area of Manchester

column2: Novavax Starts Phase 3 Trial of COVID-19 Vaccine
First US Case of New COVID-19 Variant Found in Colorado
column4: Six arrivals from UK tested positive for new strain

column2: UK Approves Emergency Authorization for the AstraZeneca and Oxford COVID-19 Vaccine
US Falls Short of Goal to Give 20 Million Vaccinations by Year End
column6: The Royal London Hospital is in "disaster medicine mode" and "no longer providing high standard critical care", according to an internal memo
